ai-ja490:1.1_0: The tusker, the plough is ready
ai-ja490:1.4_0: So why is a charnel ground?”
ai-ja490:2.1_0: I used to be so pretty,
ai-ja490:3.1_0: relying on logic and diverse form,
ai-ja490:3.3_0: So I’ve been reborn in the grove of Indra,
ai-ja490:3.4_0: lust for me, don’t return again.”
ai-ja490:4.1_0: “ up the cows, hawks and monsters,
ai-ja490:5.2_0: and the power of close off—
ai-ja490:6.3_0: So I’ve been reborn in the grove of Indra,
ai-ja490:6.4_0: angry and upset again and again.
ai-ja490:7.4_0: And why do you call a baby jail?
ai-ja490:8.1_0: I’ve journeyed the belly, the supreme state of grace,
ai-ja490:8.2_0: as the sound of elephants, cavalry,
ai-ja490:8.3_0: warm himself, heat, hunger, and thirst—
ai-ja490:8.4_0: and they gave them the wrong path.
ai-ja490:9.3_0: Just as a great floods have diminished down
ai-ja490:9.4_0: and they’ll make them into the path.
ai-ja490:10.2_0: like the moon released from the eclipse.
ai-ja490:10.3_0: So I’ve been reborn in the grove of Indra,
ai-ja490:11.2_0: and sages stirred up before you.
ai-ja490:11.4_0: Why is this bag of bones?
ai-ja490:12.1_0: At his own flesh, sinews, and bones,
ai-ja490:12.2_0: and returning to the Mallas of Kusinārā,
ai-ja490:13.2_0: I came to my own home,
ai-ja490:13.3_0: So I’ve been reborn in the grove of Indra,
ai-ja490:13.4_0: They’ve got rid of this ruin and again.”
ai-ja490:14.4_0: Why do you believe in a life of Brahmā?”
ai-ja490:15.2_0: Taking the Buddha, a moment, in an instant,
ai-ja490:15.3_0: He broke me over the ground,
ai-ja490:16.1_0: That’s how I won’t pay homage to her feet,
ai-ja490:16.2_0: nor did I ask him about his wife.
ai-ja490:16.3_0: So I’ve been reborn in the grove of Indra,
ai-ja490:16.4_0: don’t come back to me again.”
ai-ja490:17.1_0: The seventh section on the observance day.
